title: How to Make a Duct Tape Headband

steps.headline: Measure around your head and subtract three inches.
Cut a piece of tape that length.
Cut a piece of elastic/garter about 4–5 inches (10.2–12.7 cm) longer than the piece of duct tape.
Lay the elastic down in the middle of the sticky side of the tape.
Fold the duct tape around the elastic/garter.
steps.description: Fold the bottom up and the top down enclosing the elastic/garter, then smooth out any air bubbles.

steps.headline: Sew or tie the ends of the elastic together.
steps.description: You can also use really strong glue, but make sure it dries completely before you put the headband on.

steps.headline: Finished!
steps.description: Wear and show off your new duct tape headband!

text: Measure around your head and subtract three inches.  Cut a piece of tape that length.  Cut a piece of elastic/garter about 4–5 inches (10.2–12.7 cm) longer than the piece of duct tape.  Lay the elastic down in the middle of the sticky side of the tape.  Fold the duct tape around the elastic/garter. Fold the bottom up and the top down enclosing the elastic/garter, then smooth out any air bubbles. Sew or tie the ends of the elastic together. You can also use really strong glue, but make sure it dries completely before you put the headband on. Finished! Wear and show off your new duct tape headband!
